intro: Pouzolzia heterophylla, commonly known as the variable pouzolzia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its variable leaf shapes, which can range from ovate to linear, depending on environmental conditions. Its small, white or yellowish flowers are often clustered in dense inflorescences. Pouzolzia heterophylla is adapted to withstand drought and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
